channel.title: Cryptocurrency for Beginners: with Crypto Casey
channel.description: Hello, I'm Crypto Casey. I make informational and how-to videos about cryptocurrency, blockchain, and tangle technology at https://YouTube.com/CryptoCasey - My channel is about breaking down complex concepts and processes related to crypto in ways that are easy for everyone to understand. Whether you are interested in learning about how bitcoin works or looking to buy altcoins as an investment, subscribe to my channel to learn more about this exciting, new technology. As you can see, my videos break things down into easy-to-follow steps, so beginners and advanced crypto fiends alike can enjoy. Subscribe to my channel and let me know what questions you have about bitcoin, ethereum, blockchain, tangle, or any other types of cryptocurrency and I'll be glad to help. Support this podcast: https://anchor.fm/cryptocasey/support

======== VIDEO SUMMARY ========

This is a video guide for beginners all about cryptocurrency wallets.

We break down what cryptocurrency wallets are and how they work using analogies that make it easy to understand.

Unlike banks, credit unions, or traditional stock exchanges, there are no pre-built fail safes in this technology to protect your funds.

There are two cryptocurrency wallet categories I will break down for you in an easy-to-understand way. The types of wallets are known as â€œhotâ€ and â€œcoldâ€ storage.

In this video, we will learn about how private keys or recovery phrases work and how they can be used to access your funds, regardless of what wallet you set up.

Together we will install a mobile wallet, set it up, and transfer your cryptocurrency off of exchanges.

item.title: NFTs: New Asset Class (Non-Fungible Tokens) - Beginners' Guide
item.description:
This is a video guide for beginners all about the new digital asset class: NFTs or Non-Fungible Tokens.


======== $25 Worth of FREE Crypto from Crypto.com ========

â™¥ Crypto.com Signup - http://platinum.crypto.com/r/cryptocasey - Type in Referral Code: CryptoCasey and we both get $25 ğŸ™‚

â™¥ BlockFi: Earn Interest on Your Crypto - https://blockfi.com/cryptocasey

â™¦ Coinbase - Receive $10 of FREE BITCOIN when you use this link to sign up for Coinbase and invest $100: https://www.coinbase.com/join/57605a33b9140001c900020b

â™¥ Link to Join Ivan on Tech Academy at a Discount - https://academy.ivanontech.com/a/30997/8Vj9oDiu


======== VIDEO SUMMARY ========


We will discuss the nature of assets, how social agreement is forming about NFTs as a new asset class, and the current macro backdrop that is creating a perfect storm for the future potential of NFTs as valuable investment vehicles.

A non-fungible token is simply a representation of a unique digital asset that cannot be equally swapped or traded for another NFT of the same type.

So non-fungible tokens can represent digital art, a ticket to an event, an in-game item, virtual property in a virtual world, or even a real-world asset like a deed or title to actual land in the physical world.

Blockchain adds unique properties to digital assets by giving people ownership, management permissions, and transferability on a decentralized, transparent, and immutable platform.

Blockchain technology provides a coordination layer that is democratizing the creation of new digital assets in the midst of the worldâ€™s largest global asset shortage.

item.title: Crypto Collapse Soon? (Sell or HODL?) - Beginners' Guide
item.description:
This is the third video of a beginners' guide where we will break down step-by-step how the traditional financial system is structured, how the cryptocurrency market is structured, what stablecoins are, their role in the cryptocurrency market, and why stablecoins will both drive massive global adoption of cryptocurrencies, while also potentially threatening mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies.

Our goal by the end of this video series is for us to understand the traditional financial systemâ€™s relationship with the cryptocurrency market, and if a crypto collapse can happen, how and when it could happen, and what we can do to protect ourselves as investors in the space.

item.title: Structure of the Financial System (Inverted Card House?) - Beginners' Guide
item.description:
This is a beginners' guide where we will break down step-by-step how the traditional financial system is structured, how the cryptocurrency market is structured, what stablecoins are, their role in the cryptocurrency market, and why stablecoins will both drive massive global adoption of cryptocurrencies, while also potentially threatening mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies.

Our goal by the end of this video series is for us to understand the traditional financial systemâ€™s relationship with the cryptocurrency market, and if a crypto collapse can happen, how and when it could happen, and what we can do to protect ourselves as investors in the space.

item.title: What are NFT's in Crypto? (Non-Fungible Tokens!) - Beginners' Guide
item.description:
This is a guide for beginner's about NFT's, or Non-Fungible Tokens, and how they work.

â™¥ Link to Buy an Unstoppable Domain -
https://unstoppabledomains.com/r/cryptocasey

======== $25 Worth of FREE Crypto from Crypto.com ========

â™¥ Crypto.com Signup - http://platinum.crypto.com/r/cryptocasey - Type in Referral Code: CryptoCasey and we both get $25 ğŸ™‚

â™¥ BC Vault Crypto Hardware Wallet Link - https://bc-vault.com/shop/bc-vault/?wpam_id=22

â™¥ Ledger Nano X & S Hardware Wallets - https://www.ledgerwallet.com/r/befe

â™¥ Link to Join Ivan on Tech Academy at a Discount - https://academy.ivanontech.com/a/30997/8Vj9oDiu


======== VIDEO SUMMARY ========

This is a video guide for beginners all about NFT's or Non-Fungible Tokens.

We will discuss what NFTâ€™s are, how they are created, how they are being used now, and how they can be used in the future.

A non-fungible token is simply a representation of a unique digital asset that cannot be equally swapped or traded for another NFT of the same type.

So non-fungible tokens can represent digital art, a ticket to an event, an in-game item, virtual property in a virtual world, or even a real-world asset like a deed or title to actual land in the physical world.

Blockchain adds unique properties to digital assets by giving people ownership, management permissions, and transferability on a decentralized, transparent, and immutable platform.

=== VIDEO SUMMARY ===

In this episode we will talk about what happened in the markets, Ethereumâ€™s technical limits, the exponential growth of DeFiâ€™s market cap, the failing US dollar, and the massive leaps and bounds that have taken place this week, that make the past decade look like peanuts.

Bitcoinâ€™s 7-day moving average was 4.9%, and Ethereum up a staggering 23.4% overall.

As more people are discovering the power of DeFi, Ethereumâ€™s network has been inundated with tons of action, pushing Ethereum to its technical limits and causing transaction fees to soar.

Luckily this week, an update about Ethereum 2.0 was released stating the final testnet is set to launch August 4th.

In the United States, the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency has formally stated that nationally chartered banks can hold cryptocurrencies for their customers.

And the Acting Comptroller Brian Brooks, was Coinbaseâ€™s Chief Legal Officer who left them this past March to take on this US regulatory roll.

It means massive adoption near.

item.title: DeFi on Ethereum Explained - Decentralized Finance (Ultimate Beginners' Guide)
item.description:
This is a beginner's guide about DeFi, or decentralized finance, products and services being build on the Ethereum ecosystem.


=== VIDEO SUMMARY ===

DeFi is the trendy shortened version of the term â€œdecentralized finance.â€

Currently, the entire traditional finance industry is â€œcentralized.â€

So, although DeFi stands for the term â€œdecentralized finance,â€ the word DeFi is used colloquially to describe the movement or crusade towards a low-cost, fast, efficient, trustworthy, and completely transparent global financial ecosystem that operates without any central authority and is highly accessible to everyone around the world with just a smart phone or internet connection.

The new financial era will operate on the very place from which numbers, mathematics, physics, and computer science were derived: the ever-enduring fabric of the universe.

item.title: Bitcoin Halving 2020: What Halving is & Why it Happens (A Simple Explanation)
item.description:
This is a simple explanation of the bitcoin halving event that occurred in May of 2020.


=== VIDEO SUMMARY ===

In this video we will be talking about the bitcoin halving, or "halvening," event that took place in May 2020.

We go over what halving is, why halving takes place, and what implications halving has for the future of bitcoin.

The bitcoin blockchain is basically a live, running record of all the bitcoin transactions.

Once a certain amount of transaction data has been collected, a block is formed and added to the ledger.

The basic structure of the bitcoin blockchain consists of a network of computers around the world with bitcoin software installed on them.

The verification and posting of transactions on the blockchain is completed by miners via a process called mining.

The basic concept you need to know about bitcoin mining to better understand the bitcoin halving event, is that miners are rewarded with bitcoin each time they verify a new block of transactions.

These rewards are in place to incentivize miners to participate in the mining process to ensure the bitcoin network continues to be audited and essentially maintained.

Halving, in terms of bitcoin, refers to the reduction in bitcoin block rewards issued to miners by half.

When the halving occurred in May 2020, the block reward halved, or reduced by half, which gives miners 6.25 BTC of newly minted bitcoin per validated block.

item.title: Ethereum 2.0: Beacon Chain, Staking, & Sharding (A Simple Explanation!)
item.description:
This is a simple guide about the Ethereum 2.0 upgrade and what's on the horizon for the future of this blockchain project.

======== LINKS TO ACCESS SITES SAFELY ========

â™¦ Coinbase - Receive $10 of FREE BITCOIN when you use this link to sign up for Coinbase and invest $100: https://www.coinbase.com/join/57605a33b9140001c900020b

â— Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/cryptocasey/

â— YouTube: https://www.YouTube.com/cryptocasey/

â™¦ Recommended Hardware Wallet: Ledger Nano X Backup Pack Link - https://www.ledgerwallet.com/r/befe

â™¦ BC Vault Crypto Hardware Wallet - https://bc-vault.com/shop/bc-vault/?wpam_id=22

======== SUMMARY =======

This is an audio guide all about Ethereum 2.0.

Later this year, Ethereum will start to undergo a major network update that has been nicknamed Ethereum 2.0, ETH2, and Serenity.

Ethereum 2.0 will allow the platform to handle the growing demand for DApps and the DeFi movement at large.

There are many phases to this massive upgrade, so it will take a a few years until it's 100% complete.

Phase 0 is the initial phase of the Ethereum 2.0 upgrade.

Ethereum 2.0 is being built on a new blockchain network called the Beacon chain.

And on the Beacon chain, a new way of validating blocks of data will be implemented called proof-of-stake.

In Phase 1 of the ETH2 upgrade, shard chains will be implemented, which is also referred to as sharding.

And sharding is a database management technique that involves simply partitioning large databases into smaller and faster databases.

And in Phase 2, the EVM will be replaced by a new virtual machine called eWASM, which will be Ethereumâ€™s version of WebAssembly code, or WASM.

Phase 3 and beyond will involve upgrades to consensus, upgrades to scaling,and basically any further technical upgrades that need to be implemented to maintain the Ethereum 2.0 ecosystem.

======== OTHER ESSENTIAL CRYPTO RESOURCES ========

And on the Beacon chain, a new way of validating blocks of data will be implemented called proof-of-stake.

In Phase 1 of the ETH2 upgrade, shard chains will be implemented, which is also referred to as sharding.

And sharding is a database management technique that involves simply partitioning large databases into smaller and faster databases.

And in Phase 2, the EVM will be replaced by a new virtual machine called eWASM, which will be Ethereumâ€™s version of WebAssembly code, or WASM.

Phase 3 and beyond will involve upgrades to consensus, upgrades to scaling,and basically any further technical upgrades that need to be implemented to maintain the Ethereum 2.0 ecosystem.

item.title: Important Concepts About Investing & Cryptocurrency Technology (for Beginners!)
item.description:
This is a podcast for beginners about basic investing and technology concepts that are important to understand before investing in digital assets like Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrencies.

That way you have a solid foundation to build your cryptocurrency knowledge on going forward as an informed investor.

Iâ€™ve broken up this guide into 3 chapters to make it easy for you to follow and understand.

Make sure you check out my YouTube channel at YouTube.com/CryptoCasey for video versions of these podcasts.

Before you start transforming some of your wealth into digital assets like cryptocurrency, I want to share with you two important things you need to know.

Number one, these types of investments are not like anything else you may be familiar with.Â 

Unlike banks, credit unions, and traditional stock exchanges, there are virtually no fail safes in place to protect you if you make a mistake or donâ€™t understand what youâ€™re doing.

The second thing you need to know is the golden rule of investing:

NEVER invest more than you can afford to lose.

So you need to figure out an amount you are comfortable investing and, more importantly, an amount you can truly afford to invest â€“ then you need to stick with that amount and be patient in the process.

item.title: What Blockchain is & How Blockchain Technology Works (Simple Overview)
item.description:
Blockchain Explained: What is Blockchain and How does Blockchain Technology Work? This is a Simple Explanation of Blockchain Technology!

Receive $10 of FREE BITCOIN when you use this link to sign up for Coinbase and invest $100: https://www.coinbase.com/join/57605a3...

This video provides simple examples about how blockchain works, why the technology was created, how blockchain is being used now with bitcoin, and how blockchain could be used in the future.

The blockchain foundation allows bitcoin currency transactions to occur securely and privately, while maintaining the accuracy of the transactions by posting a time-stamped, unmodifiable record of the transaction to a public ledger without the use of a third party.

Blockchain technology creates transparency, validates and secures records, and eliminates middleman or third parties.

item.title: Ethereum 2020 Explained: What is Ethereum & How it Works (Ultimate Beginner's Guide)
item.description:
This is a simple explanation of what Ethereum is and how it works.

======== LINKS TO ACCESS SITES SAFELY ========

â™¦ Coinbase - Receive $10 of FREE BITCOIN when you use this link to sign up for Coinbase and invest $100: https://www.coinbase.com/join/57605a33b9140001c900020b

â— Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/cryptocasey/

â— YouTube: https://www.YouTube.com/cryptocasey/

â™¦ Recommended Hardware Wallet: Ledger Nano X Backup Pack Link - https://www.ledgerwallet.com/r/befe

â™¦ BC Vault Crypto Hardware Wallet - https://bc-vault.com/shop/bc-vault/?wpam_id=22


======== SUMMARY =======

This is an audio guide all about Ethereum.

Vitalik Buterin, is a Russian-Canadian programmer and cryptocurrency researcher who came up with the idea for Ethereum in 2013, which finally went live in 2015.

The most plain and simple explanation of Ethereum can be broken down into two words:

Software platform.

Now, what makes Ethereum different from other software platforms is that it is a blockchain-based software platform.

The most plain and simple explanation of blockchain is that itâ€™s records of data stored on a network of computers.

Ether is the Ethereum blockchainâ€™s native cryptocurrency.

To incentivize people to host and maintain the data on the blockchain, Ether was created as a form of payment to fuel the Ethereum network.

Later this year, Ethereum will start to undergo a major network update that has been nicknamed Ethereum 2.0, Eth2, and Serenity.

One of the main goals of this update is to improve the Ethereum networkâ€™s efficiency and ability to scale.

Ethereum 2.0 will allow the platform to handle the growing demand for DApps and the DeFi movement at large.

There are many phases to this massive upgrade, so if everything stays on schedule,Â  it will be a few years until the upgrade is 100% implemented and complete.

item.title: What Bitcoin is & How Bitcoin Works (A Simple Explanation)
item.description:
This is an audio guide for beginners about what bitcoin is and how it works.

======== LINKS TO ACCESS SITES SAFELY ========

â™¦ Coinbase - Receive $10 of FREE BITCOIN when you use this link to sign up for Coinbase and invest $100: https://www.coinbase.com/join/57605a33b9140001c900020b

â™¦ Recommended Hardware Wallet: Ledger Nano X Backup Pack Link - https://www.ledgerwallet.com/r/befe

â™¦ BC Vault Crypto Hardware Wallet - https://bc-vault.com/shop/bc-vault/?wpam_id=22

======== SUMMARY ========

We break down bitcoin into simple concepts together, so by the end of the podcast, you will understand why bitcoin was created and the technology behind bitcoin.

If you Google search, â€œWhat is Bitcoin?,â€ you get answers like: â€œBitcoin is the first decentralized open source, peer-to-peer network that is powered by its users with no central authority or middlemen using blockchain technology.â€

Bitcoin may seem like a difficult concept to wrap your head around, yet itâ€™s actually way simpler than most people think.Â 

Using bitcoin, you can send and receive value directly to anyone around the world, anytime.

One of the hangups people have with understanding bitcoin, is just another thing weâ€™ve been conditioned to accept as standard business practice: which is separation between value and storage or transference of that value.

So we own and hold fiat like US dollars as something representative of value, yet use completely separate mechanisms to actually use it, store it, and move it around.

So instead of having fiat represent value and paying financial businesses like Venmo and JP-Morgan Chase to move it around and store it, Bitcoin is both value and a means to transfer, store, and manage that value.

This is because bitcoin is both digital value and itâ€™s a network that can store and transfer the bits of digital value.

Value and usage of the value is simply one unified system in the case of bitcoin.
